title: New Zealand's Steve Hansen plays down engaging in 'mind games' with Eddie Jones ahead of England semi-final
text:
The All Blacks were prepared for the barbs over pressure and spying that were thrown their way by Eddie Jones on Tuesday as the build-up to the World Cup semi-final on Saturday intensified with both coaches giving press conferences at similar times in different parts of the city.

New Zealand head coach, Steve Hansen, knew that something would be coming in his direction although he might not have expected it to be delivered only 15 minutes after he began his own briefing in Shiodome.

The two coaches are good pals and highly respectful of the work the other has done down the years. Hansen, who is not adverse to launching a few curve balls himself in an effort to claim the headlines or to unsettle...
description: The All Blacks were prepared for the barbs over pressure and spying that were thrown their way by Eddie Jones on Tuesday as the build-up to the World Cup semi-final on Saturday intensified with both coaches giving press conferences at similar times in different parts of the city.
